original: dhva dz'a gra ke y'ur s'a dha nam /
analyzed: dhva dz'a gra ke y'ur s'a dha nam /

original: rgyal mtshan rtse mo'i dpung rgyang gi sgrub thabs /
analyzed: rgyal mtshan rtse mo'i dpung rgyang gi sgrub thabs /

original: rgyal mtshan rtse mo'i dbung rgyan sku mdog nag mo zhal gsum phyag bzhi ma'o //
analyzed: rgyal mtshan rtse mo'i dbung rgyan sku mdog nag mo zhal gsum phyag bzhi ma'o //
translated: The Dhvajāgrakeyūra has a black-colored body, three faces, and four arms.

original: g-yas pa dang g-yon pa'i zhal ni dmar mo dang ljang gu'o //
analyzed: g-yas pa dang g-yon pa'i zhal ni dmar mo dang ljang gu'o //
translated: The right and left faces are red and green, respectively.

original: ral gri dang zhags pa bsnams pa ni g-yas pa'i phyag gnyis so //
analyzed: ral gri dang zhags pa bsnams pa ni g-yas pa'i phyag gnyis so //
translated: The two right hands hold a sword and a noose.

original: rdo rjes mtshan pa'i kha tv'am ga dang 'khor lo ni g-yon pa'i phyag gnyis na ste sgra kham ser gyen du gyur pa /
analyzed: rdo rjes mtshan pa'i kha tv'am ga dang 'khor lo ni g-yon pa'i phyag gnyis na ste sgra kham ser gyen du gyur pa /
translated: The two left hands hold a khaṭvāṅga marked with a vajra and a chakram.

original: dbu la thod pa skam po lngas rgyan du mdzad pa stag gi lpags pa'i sham thabs can /
analyzed: dbu la thod pa skam po lngas rgyan du mdzad pa stag gi lpags pa'i sham thabs can /
translated: On her head, she wears a head ornament of five dry skulls. She wears a tiger-skin skirt.

original: zhal gyi mche ba gtsigs par gyur pa gsus pa 'phyang bar gyur pa g-yas bskum pa'i zhabs kyis nyi ma'i gdan dang 'od zer can te /
analyzed: zhal gyi mche ba gtsigs par gyur pa gsus pa 'phyang bar gyur pa g-yas bskum pa'i zhabs kyis nyi ma'i gdan dang 'od zer can te /
translated: Her face bares fangs, her belly hangs low, and she stands on a sun seat with her right leg bent and the left leg straight.

original: stod shag ser po mnabs par gyur pa dang / sa bon ni h'um dang dbu rgyan la mi bskyod pa'o //
analyzed: stod shag ser po mnabs par gyur pa dang / sa bon ni h'um dang dbu rgyan la mi bskyod pa'o //
translated: He wears a yellow upper garment, and his seed syllable is hūṃ, with Akṣobhya as his head ornament.

original: rgyal mtshan rtse mo'i dpung rgyan gyi sgrub thabs aa bha ya las dge slong tshul khrims rgyal mtshan gyis bsgyur ba'o//
analyzed: rgyal mtshan rtse mo'i dpung rgyan gyi sgrub thabs aa bha ya las dge slong tshul khrims rgyal mtshan gyis bsgyur ba'o//
translated: The sādhana of Ketu’s Armlet was translated by the monk Tsültrim Gyaltsen from a text by Abhayākaragupta.
